data.title: 2 provincial court judges appointed in Saskatchewan
data.description: The Saskatchewan government announced two appointments including Bradley Shane Mitchell as a new provincial court judge in Saskatoon.

data.title: Saskatchewan emitter Co-op considering sustainable investments
data.description: One of Saskatchewan’s largest emitters is looking to invest in carbon-capture technology.

data.title: Winter camping starting up in Saskatchewan parks
data.description: Winter camping in Saskatchewan is available at Buffalo Pound, Cypress Hills, Duck Mountain, Echo Valley, Great Blue Heron, Moose Mountain and Pike Lake Provincial Parks.

data.title: Sask. COVID-19 hospitalizations fall below 200; province adds two deaths
data.description: It's the first time since Sept. 12 that Saskatchewan has reported less than 200 COVID-19 hospitalizations in the province.

data.title: Saskatchewan weather outlook: Nov. 5
data.description: The seven-day Saskatchewan forecast with Peter Quinlan on Friday, Nov. 5.

data.title: Three businesses raise $50,000 to two Indigenous organizations
data.description: Two Indigenous organizations received a $25,000 donation each that were proceeds of orange t-shirts that were created and sold from three clothing businesses.

data.title: Shaping Saskatchewan: Laurie O’Connor
data.description: This week on Shaping Saskatchewan, Laurie O’Connor shows Chris Carr how the Saskatoon Food Bank goes well beyond simply serving people in crisis.

data.title: Shaping Saskatchewan: Laurie O’Connor
data.description: This week on Shaping Saskatchewan, Laurie O'Connor shows Chris Carr how the Saskatoon Food Bank goes well beyond simply serving people in crisis.

data.title: Inmate escapes from Willow Cree Healing Lodge
data.description: Correctional Service Canada says an arrest warrant has been issued for Norman Cardinal, 34, who escaped from Willow Cree Healing Lodge.

data.title: COVID-19: Can doctors refuse unvaccinated patients? Reports suggest this is already happening
data.description: "Rewriting medical ethics," unvaccinated Americans and Canadians claim they've been denied medical care, including organ transplants.
